Redundant parentheses around the subscript expression.
Inner parentheses are unnecessary because + and - are left-associative; outer parentheses are kept to bind the numerator before division.

removals.expression: (dot + ((alpha * A[(i * nk + k)]) * B[(k * nj + j)]))
removals.replacement: dot + ((alpha * A[(i * nk + k)]) * B[(k * nj + j)])
removals.reasoning: Assignment does not require parentheses around the entire RHS; removing them does not affect evaluation.

removals.expression: ((alpha * A[(i * nk + k)]) * B[(k * nj + j)])
removals.replacement: (alpha * A[(i * nk + k)]) * B[(k * nj + j)]
removals.reasoning: Multiplication is left-associative; outer parentheses around the product are redundant.
Parentheses around a single multiplicative term are unnecessary.

removals.replacement: tmp[(i * nj + j)] * C[(j * nl + l)]
